questions.uddipok:
Read the passage carefully and answer questions.
Humans can neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun, But they can control the increase in the amount of greenhouse gases and its effect on the atmosphere. Only during the last hundred years the carbon dioxide concentration has been raised alarmingly in the atmosphere and we humans can be held responsible for this. The main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is the burning of fossil fuels. Since the end of the 19th century, industrial activities increased rapidly giving rise to many factories. These factories required energy, which was produced through the combustion of coal. Besides coal, other sources of energy such as mineral òil and natural gas were also burned to heat our houses, run cars and airplanes or to produce electricity. Nowadays, about 85 million barrels of crude oil are burned daily. Every time a fossil raw material is burned, it roleases carbon dioxide into the air. Therefore, it is clear that more and more greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide are being generated worldwide by humans. Moreover, we are also strengthening the greenhouse effect by deforestation, which means cutting down trees. Every year enormous areas of forests are destroyed by people to obtain wood and to clear regions for mining and to create pasture. This loss of the forest causes dual problems. Trees that are burned up release large volumes of carbon dioxide gas into the air. On the other hand, as forest absorb a lot of carbon dioxide from the air and deliver oxygen instead, we also destroy an important storehouse of carbon dioxide when we clear forests.

questions.uddipok:
Rearrange the following sentences into correct order. Only the corresponding numbers of the sentences need to be written:
(a) Returning home from England in 1913, he took over his father's enterprise after his father's death.
(b) He did his B.Sc in Chemistry from Presidency College in 1911.
(c) Sukumar Roy, a famous children's writer, was born in Kolkata in 1887.
(d) He then went to England to ştudy photography and printing technology.
(e) Sukumar Roy passed away in 1923 in Kolkata, India.
(f) His family was originally from Masua in Mymensingh.
(g) He passed the Entrance examination from City School, Kolkata.
(h) His prominent writings are Abol-Tabol, Ha-Ya-Ba-Ra-La, Pagla Dashu and Bahurupi.

sub_questions.explanation:
Ans: c + f + g + b + d + a + h + e
Sukumar Roy, a famous children's writer, was born in Kolkata in 1887. His family was originally from Masua in Mymensingh. He passed the Entrance examination from City School, Kolkata. He did his B.Sc in Chemistry from Presidency College in 1911. He then went to England to study photography and printing technology. Returning home from England in 1913, he took over his father's enterprise after his father's death. His prominent writings are Abol-Tabol, Ha-Ya-Ba-Ra-La, Pagla Dashu and Bahurupi. Sukumar Roy passed away in 1923 in Kolkata, India.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'The Importance of Learning English'.
(a) What are the benefits of learning English? (b) What will happen if you do not learn English? (c) Why is English globally used? (d) How can you lcarn English effectively?

sub_questions.explanation:
Importance of Learning English
The language which is widely used all over the world for smooth communication is called an international language. English is an international language as it is used for international communication in many countries. 'Now, it has created its appeal all over the world and has become a must for multilateral communication. It is а universal fact that the world cannot go for a single day without English. In order to keep pace with the present world, we should have a good command over English. For maintaining communication' with foreign countries and international organizations, we should learn English. Moreover, in order to have an access to the latest knowledge, research ofthe world,. we need to learn English. Most of the records, documents and particulars are written in English. All the journals, magazines, articles and papers are also written in English. Besides, for the sake of higher education, we should learn it. Again, we should learn English because it can ensure our future career. People having a good command over English are highly valued in the job market. However, learning English is not an easy task. One should, learn the grammatical rules very carefully. Without learning grammar, it is not possible to have a good command over English. Our present English textbook which is based on the communicative purposes, is very helpful for learning English. It introduces us with the communicative functions of English and helps us use it in practical situations.

Once there lived a poor woodcutter in a village near a jungle. He used to cut woods from the forest and sell it in the market. But one day, while cutting wood………..

sub_questions.explanation:
The Honest Woodcutter
Once there lived a poor woodcutter in a village near a jungle. He used to cut woods from the forest and sell it in the market. But one day, while cutting wood, his axe slipped from his hand and fell into a deep river nearby. The woodcutter became very sad because it was the only axe he had, and he could not afford a new one.
He sat on the riverbank and started crying. Suddenly, a kind fairy appeared from the water and asked him why he was crying. The woodcutter told her everything. The fairy dived into the river and came up with a golden axe . “Is this yours?” she asked. The woodcutter said, “No, this is not mine.”
Then she brought a silver axe and asked the same question. Again, the woodcutter replied, “No, that’s not mine either.” Finally, she brought his old iron axe , and he happily said, “Yes! That one is mine!”
The fairy was very pleased with his honesty and gave him all three axes as a reward. The woodcutter went home joyfully and lived happily ever after. His honesty brought him unexpected blessings.

questions.uddipok: The graph below shows the percentage of the students choice of reading books from the library of ABC Model High School, Dhaka in the academic session 2023. Now, describe the graph in about 150 words. You should highlight and summarize the information given in the graph.

sub_questions.explanation:
The graph illustrates the percentage of students’ choice of reading books from the library of ABC Model High School, Dhaka, during the academic session of 2023. It compares the popularity of five categories of books: Story Books, Poems, Science Books, History Books, and Journals.
According to the graph, Story Books were the most popular among students, with 65% preferring them. Close behind were Science Books , chosen by 62% of students. These two categories clearly dominated the preferences.
On the other hand, Poems and History Books were less popular, with 38% and 35% of students choosing them respectively. Journals had a moderate preference, with 40% of the students opting for them.
Overall, it is evident that students at ABC Model High School are more interested in reading Story and Science Books compared to other categories. This reflects a balance between interest in imagination and scientific learning among the students.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Abid/Abida. You are going to celebrate your birthday next week. Kabir/Kabita is your friend who lives in Cumilla. Now, write an email to invite him/her to attend your birthday party.

Dear Kabita,
I hope you’re doing well! I’m really excited to let you know that I’ll be celebrating my birthday next week, and I would be so happy if you could join me on this special day.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Shipon/Shilpi. Nabil/Nabila is your friend. Both of you have some hobbies. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about your favourite hobby.

sub_questions.explanation:
Shilpi: Hey Nabila! How are you doing today?
Nabila: Hi Shilpi! I’m doing great. How about you?
Shilpi: I’m good too! I was just reading a new novel. You know how much I love reading books.
Nabila: Oh yes, I know! Reading is your favorite hobby, right?
Shilpi: Absolutely! I enjoy getting lost in stories. It helps me relax and also improves my imagination. What about you? What’s your favorite hobby?
Nabila: I love painting! Whenever I have free time, I take out my brushes and start creating something new.
Shilpi: That’s amazing! Painting needs a lot of creativity. What do you like to paint the most?
Nabila: I enjoy painting nature—like trees, rivers, and sunsets. It makes me feel peaceful. And I think painting is a great way to express emotions too.
Shilpi: That’s so beautiful. I’d love to see your paintings someday!
Nabila: And I’d love to share them with you! Maybe one day, you can read one of your favorite books while I paint the scene.
Shilpi: That sounds like a perfect day! Hobbies really make life more enjoyable, don’t they?
Nabila: Totally agree! They keep us happy and stress-free
